results.title: Dissonant particles
results.brief_description:
An abstract animation based on experiments with sound. Gordon describes the work as follows “Psychoacoustic experiments have indicated that two pure sine tones are played simultaneously, they will sound most dissonant when they are around a semitone apart in pitch. In Dissonant Particles, each particle emits a sine tone. The dissonance between them acts as a repulsive force that pushes the particles apart, both in position and in pitch. There is also a long-range (“cosmological”) attractive force that prevents the particles from flying off to infinity. The particles pulsate and slowly evaporate; both of these processes affect the way they “feel” the forces acting on them. The colour of a particle indicates pitch: red for low pitches, green for intermediate, and blue for high. The camera tracks one particle, which is always shown in the centre of the screen.”
Psycho acoustics is the study of subjective experience of audio versus the scientific measurement of sound by various devices. For example, the frequency of a signal may not change but we may perceive pitch changes if the amplitude changes.
http://www.gordonmonro.com/pieces/dissparticles.html

results.title: Dissection of the heart (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Autopsy Dissection Technique”.
Shows the dissection and removal of the heart from the pericardial sac. Demonstrates in detail the opening of the various chambers, the dissection of the coronary arteries, and the examination of the various valves and their measurement. Concludes with the method of cutting and examining the myocardium.

results.title: Dispute
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, Leon Clore and Fred Moore
results.brief_description: A study of a typical industrial dispute and the real reason behind it. A personal incident between an operative and a foreman grows, until the whole factory is brought to a stand-still. Concentrates in turn on the operative, the foreman, the shop steward and the factory manager, showing how each of them came to take the attitude he did and how each felt he had no alternative and was unable to withdraw.

results.title: Dispensing a cure
results.brief_description: One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region. Ian Darling and Doug McColl have each practised pharmacy for over forty years in the Warracknabeal district. In this film they recall the era when most drugs were hand-made on the premises, generally from raw materials. Ian also tells of the mysterious medicine jar labelled ‘ADT’ and of an old-fashioned coin-operated machine for a self administered electric shock.

results.title: Disney Masterclass with Roy Conli and Glen Keane
results.brief_description:
Disney Animator Glen Keane and Producer Roy Conli presented a special Masterclass sharing their behind-the-scenes insights and love of the animation process.
Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. He reflects on the inspirations for some of his characters and expressing yourself through drawing.
Roy Conli is the producer of the Disney feature animated film, ‘Tangled’, based on the story of Rapunzel. He explains the role of the producer and the line between creating a safe and fertile environment for artists and getting a film made on time and within budget.

results.title: Disney's very merry Christmas songs
results.brief_description: Join your favourite Disney characters in these traditional Christmas songs including “Deck the Halls”, “Jingle Bells”, “Joy to the World”, “Let it Snow!”, “Sleigh Ride”, “Parade of the Wooden Soldiers”, “Winter Wonderland”, “Here Comes Santa Claus”, “Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer”, “Silent Night” and “We Wish You a Merry Christmas”. The words of the carols appear on screen so you can sing along.

results.title: Disney's haunted Halloween
results.brief_description: Goofy learns from an animated Jack O’Lantern that Halloween is a great time to find out about old time holiday traditions and superstitions. Looks at why people dress in costumes and how “trick” or “treating” started. The program also contains appropriate warnings about cautious behaviour during such a festive time.
